title: Bubbles in boiling of water contain water vapor

content.question: A beaker was half filled with freshly distilled <math alttext="H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and placed on a hot plate. As the temperature of the water reached <math alttext="100 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><mi>Â°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, vigorous bubbling was observed in the beaker. The gaseous contents of the bubbles were analyzed. The presence of which of the following substances would support the claim that the observed phenomenon was a physical change?

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from experimental data.
